overview: Matthew Greenfield co-manages Stonework Capital, an ethically-oriented hedge fund and is also an active angel investor with a particular interest in web-based education businesses. His successful exits include Wireless Generation (acquired by News Corp.), Wellfleet/Bay Networks (acquired by Nortel), and Synernetics (acquired by 3Com). He co-founded Rethink Autism and has made investments in other education businesses including 2tor, BetterLesson, Engrade, Post University, and Comfit. He has three other SaaS investments: Ascentis, Accordant Media, and Analog Analytics. He has a B.A., M.A., and Ph.D. in English from Yale University, where he won six English prizes, and has taught at Bowdoin College and the City University of New York. While in graduate school he helped start Blackwell’s Compass online publication family and served as an editor of the Yale Journal of Law and the Humanities. He has published in journals including PMLA, Raritan, and the Paris Review.
